/* Labor Unions */ Thuranx, I thought you did a wholesale revert. Most of your revision doesn't bother me except this sentence. Putting Bennetts title outside of sentence is unnecessary.
wholesale reversion seems to be the order of the day, so here we go. Chronologically based writing needs setting (time, date) established clearly.
/* Early years */ restored one of Thuranx revisions.
Dates need to follow rule of "Who, What, When" not "When, What." Putting the date at the beg of sentence makes it an unimportant date and causes the reader to backtrack.

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Elliwood82|Elliwood82]] ([[User talk:Elliwood82|talk]]) to last version by SieBot
/* World War II era */ Page 333---again, Washington's WWII liaison w FMC was w Sorensen et al & not with HF1. HF1 refused to be helpful in war program.
/* World War II era */ Page 286 also a good example---HF1 not on board with WWII war effort. Suspicious of conspiracies by GM, DuPont, FDR.
/* Later career */ Sorensen 1956 says they were strokes. 1938 and again in 1941.
/* Later career */ Here's the first of the new citations.
"Death" section was oversimplified to point of inaccuracy; replaced with 2 sections, "Later career" and "Death".
/* Early years */ adding ref link for birth location (not in sweden as suggested in talk page)
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Kidmulso|Kidmulso]] ([[User talk:Kidmulso|talk]]) to last version by Three-quarter-ten
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/FuriousGeorge160|FuriousGeorge160]] ([[User talk:FuriousGeorge160|talk]]) to last version by Three-quarter-ten
/* Ford Airplane Company */ I had meant not to delete this Smithsonian sentence entirely but only move it up to the Trimotor era.
/* Willow Run */ HF1 himself was NOT driving force behind Willow Run program; Sorensen was. HF1 by WWII hated Roosevelt, felt USA should not be in WWII, & left it to others at FoMoCo to do war work.
/* Memoirs by Ford Motor Company principals */ Changing to syntax that works with {{Harvnb}}.)
/* Memoirs by Ford Motor Company principals */ Changing to syntax that works with {{Harvnb}}.
deleted reference to Henry & Clara adopting a baby from China.
/* The "invention of the assembly line" */ Meatpacker ref discussed in proper depth at [[assembly line]]. Better to have readers click thru for whole story rather than distortingly oversimplify here.
one more clause, which is almost a trivial in the scope of the lead.
dropped two dependent clauses which are explained within the article, and unnecessarily bulk up the lead, as well as 'sole', if there were other owners, we'd use 'co-', 'owner' means one.
/* Memoirs by Ford Motor Company principals */ | authorlink = Charles E. Sorensen
/* Sidelights */ Expansion, and organization. Some of the things in this section will eventually need to be broken out of "Sidelights". But enough for now.
/* International business */ idealistic predictions---<ref>Ford and Crowther 1922:242-244.</ref>
/* Labor philosophy */ Changes and expansion; <ref>Ford and Crowther 1922:126-130.</ref>
/* Labor philosophy */ Ford says that with this voluntary change, labor turnover in his plants went from huge to so small that he stopped bothering to measure it.<ref>Ford 1922:129-130.</ref>
/* Labor philosophy */ believed that productivity gains that obviated certain jobs would nevertheless stimulate the larger economy and grow new jobs elsewhere, whether within same corp or in others.
/* Memoirs by Ford Motor Company principals */ [[Template:LCCN]]
/* Labor philosophy */ His explanation of why he was against unions. <ref>Ford 1922:253-266.</ref>
/* References */ Subhead for this subsection. === Memoirs by Ford Motor Company principals ===
/* References */ More info on co-editions per catalog.loc.gov
/* References */ ISBN at Sorensen's book was for "Today and Tomorrow". While fixing that, looked up other pub info such as publishers and locations.
